info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 15 at 5:14PM MST until June 15 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... Southeastern Graham County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 615 PM MST.
* At 514 PM MST, areas of blowing dust were located along Highway 191 from Elfrida through Sunizona and towards Interstate 10, moving north at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Between one half mile and one mile visibility with strong winds in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* Locations impacted include... Willcox, Bowie, Dragoon, Pearce-Sunsites, Chiricahua National Monument, Cochise, Elfrida, Sunizona and Kansas Settlement.
This includes the following highways... Route 181 between mile markers 39 and 64. Route 191 between mile markers 20 and 105. Route 266 between mile markers 105 and 115. Interstate 10 between mile markers 321 and 378. Route 186 between mile markers 327 and 359.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
